intro: Aruncus vulgaris var. americanus, commonly known as American goat's beard, is a perennial plant native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its tall, branched stems and showy, feathery white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has large, palmately lobed leaves that are deeply divided, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, shady woodland habitats and is often found along stream banks and in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and naturalized areas.
